definitions.usage_note: 及物动词。指从一端穿过或横越某区域到达另一端。

sentences.en: The explorers traversed the desert on camels.
sentences.zh: 探险者骑着骆驼穿越沙漠。

sentences.en: It took them three days to traverse the mountain range.
sentences.zh: 他们花了三天时间穿越山脉。

sentences.en: The bridge traverses the river at its narrowest point.
sentences.zh: 这座桥在河流最窄处横跨两岸。

sentences.en: The soldiers had to traverse difficult terrain under cover of darkness.
sentences.zh: 士兵们不得不在夜幕掩护下穿越险峻地形。

sentences.en: Migratory birds traverse vast distances each year.
sentences.zh: 候鸟每年跨越辽阔的距离。

sentences.en: They traversed the country by train.

cross.diffs: cross 较日常；traverse 较正式，多指艰难或大范围的穿越

sentences.en: We crossed the street at the pedestrian crossing.
sentences.zh: 我们在人行横道过马路。

span.diffs: span 多指桥梁、时间等跨越；traverse 强调穿过、穿越

navigate.diffs: navigate 强调找到路径；traverse 强调完成穿越

sentences.en: The army was forced to retreat.

definitions.usage_note: 可数名词。指穿越的行为或横越的路线。

sentences.en: The traverse of the glacier took six hours.
sentences.zh: 穿越冰川花了六个小时。

sentences.en: They planned a traverse of the continental divide.
sentences.zh: 他们计划横穿大陆分水岭。

sentences.en: The ski traverse across the backcountry was challenging.
sentences.zh: 穿越野外的滑雪路线颇具挑战性。

etymology.origin: 来自拉丁语 transversare（横穿），源自 trans-（横过）+ vertere（转、转向）。
etymology.history: trans- 表“横过”，vertere 表“转”，合起来指“转向横过”即“横穿”。

sentences.en: Tree traversal is a fundamental algorithm.
The path is traversable in summer.

common_mistakes.explain: traverse 本身已含“穿过”之意，不再需要 through。应说 traverse the desert，不说 traverse through the desert。

mnemonics.content: trans-（横过）+ verse（转）→ 转向横过 → 穿越。与 transverse（横向的）同源。
